Package com.sync.db

Class SyncedObject<T extends Syncable>

java.lang.Object
com.sync.db.SyncedObject<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
Syncable, Serializable
public class SyncedObject<T extends Syncable> extends Object implements Syncable
A wrapper for POJO which make it syncable.

  • Constructor Details

    • SyncedObject

      public SyncedObject(T object)
      Creates a syncable object with default object. This object will be synced with the database. If not already exist in the database, then this is initialized by the default object.
      Parameters:
      object - The default object to use when it is not present in database.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(SyncedObject.SyncableObjectManager<T> manager)
      Updates the field of the object as defined in the interface. Just modify the object of SyncedObject.SyncableObjectManager.update(Object) method and it will also modify this object. This update will be immediately asynchronously reflected to the database.
      Parameters:
      manager - The interface defining the object.

    • get

      public T get()
      Returns the syncable mutable object that can be further modified. Any modification made to the POJO returned by this method will not be automatically saved to the database. You have to call SyncDB.commit() to commit it to database.
      Returns:
      The mutable POJO that is constructed by the class.

    • delete

      public void delete()
      Removes this object from the database. After calling this, it will be no-more syncing with the database until it is updated or modified. This will only be removed when SyncDB.commit() is called.
